atoms.title: Before You Start
atoms.text:
### Introduction
In this lesson, we will focus on the validation part of the QMV process in more depth.

In this lesson we will take a closer look at what it means to measure and validate the performance of models that you've build.

We will go through an example validating a classification model. Specifically, we will teach you how you can get the best performance from a model and define what are the common measures and metrics of performance.
  
### Downloads
This [download link](https://www.udacity.com/api/nodes/3610138592/supplemental_media/lesson-4-fileszip/download) contains the files that you need to follow along Rishi in lesson 4.

concepts.title: Intro to Validation and Connected Cars

atoms.title: Intro to Validation and Connected Cars
Choosing a Different Metric
atoms.instructor_notes: What other some other possible metrics that we can use in this scenario? Feel free to share your thoughts in this [class forum thread](http://forums.udacity.com/questions/100245977/lesson-4-validation-choosing-a-different-metric#ud919).

concepts.title: Mean square error and bias variance

atoms.title: Mean square error and bias variance
atoms.instructor_notes: You can read The Elements of Statistical Learning at [this link](http://statweb.stanford.edu/~tibs/ElemStatLearn/).

atoms.title: VC Dimension
atoms.instructor_notes: Please check out Udacity and Georgia Tech's [Supervised Machine Learning course](https://www.udacity.com/course/ud675)  to learn how to calculate VC dimensions and bounds on generalization error

concepts.title: Why are you Building A Model

atoms.title: Why are you Building A Model
Selecting Between Types Of Models
atoms.instructor_notes: Please check out Udacity's [Intro to Machine Learning](https://www.udacity.com/course/ud120) to learn more about these models.

atoms.title: Discussion
atoms.instructor_notes: You can share your thoughts at this [forum discussion](http://forums.udacity.com/questions/100244994/lesson-4-validation-discussion-what-is-the-slope-of-the-line-that-will-give-isometric-accuracy#ud919)

concepts.title: Performance Metrics Precision, Recall and F Score

atoms.title: Performance Metrics Precision, Recall and F Score
Precision
atoms.instructor_notes:
What are some other scenarios where precision will be important? Rishi mentioned keyword search is a good example, but what are some other good examples?

Please share your thoughts with other students in this [forum thread](http://forums.udacity.com/questions/100245948/lesson-4-validation-precision-examples#ud919).

atoms.title: F Beta Score
atoms.instructor_notes: If you would like to discuss why F1, F0.5, or F2 is appropriate in these two scenarios, please feel free to share your thoughts with your students in this [forum thread](http://forums.udacity.com/questions/100245944/lesson-4-validation-f-beta-score#ud919).
